com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client

Class RemoteRepositoryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.RemoteRepositoryDecls
      • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.RemoteRepositoryBase
        • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.RemoteRepositoryManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class RemoteRepositoryManager
extends RemoteRepositoryBase
implements AutoCloseable
    A manager for connections to one or more REST API / SPARQL end points for the same bigdata service.
    Author:
    bryan

    • Field Detail

      • useLBS

        protected final boolean useLBS
        When true, the REST API methods will use the load balancer aware requestURLs. The load balancer has essentially zero cost when not using HA, so it is recommended to always specify true. When false, the REST API methods will NOT use the load balancer aware requestURLs.
        See Also:
        HALoadBalancer

      • httpClient

        protected final org.eclipse.jetty.client.HttpClient httpClient
        The client used for http connections.

      • executor

        protected final Executor executor
        Thread pool for processing HTTP responses in background.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteRepositoryManager

        public RemoteRepositoryManager()
        Create a manager that is not aware of a specific blazegraph backend. This constructor is intended for patterns where a sparql end point is available but the top-level serviceURL for blazegraph is either not visible or not known: 
         new RemoteRepositoryManager().getRepositoryForURL(sparqlEndpointURL)
        The same pattern MAY be used to perform SPARQL QUERY or SPARQL UPDATE operations against non-blazegraph sparql end points.

      • RemoteRepositoryManager

        public RemoteRepositoryManager(String serviceURL)
        Create a manager client for the specified serviceURL. The serviceURL has the typical form 
         http://host:port/bigdata
        The serviceURL can be used to obtain sparql end point URLs for:
        The default namespace
        http://host:port/bigdata/sparql
        The XYZ namespace
        http://host:port/bigdata/namespace/XYZ/sparql
        The serviceURL can also be used to access the multi-tenancy API and the transaction management API. See the wiki for more details.
        Parameters:
        serviceURL - The path to the root of the web application (without the trailing "/"). /sparql will be appended to this path to obtain the SPARQL end point for the default data set.

      • RemoteRepositoryManager

        public RemoteRepositoryManager(String serviceURL,
                               boolean useLBS)
        Create a remote client for the specified serviceURL that optionally use the load balanced URLs.
        Parameters:
        serviceURL - The path to the root of the web application (without the trailing "/"). /sparql will be appended to this path to obtain the SPARQL end point for the default data set.
        useLBS - When true, the REST API methods will use the load balancer aware requestURLs. The load balancer has essentially zero cost when not using HA, so it is recommended to always specify true. When false, the REST API methods will NOT use the load balancer aware requestURLs.

      • RemoteRepositoryManager

        public RemoteRepositoryManager(String serviceURL,
                               org.eclipse.jetty.client.HttpClient httpClient,
                               Executor executor)
        Create a remote client for the specified serviceURL.
        Parameters:
        serviceURL - The path to the root of the web application (without the trailing "/"). /sparql will be appended to this path to obtain the SPARQL end point for the default data set.
        httpClient - If the client implements AutoCloseable then it will be closed by close() (optional). When not present, an HttpClient will be allocated and scoped to this RemoteRepositoryManager instance.
        executor - An executor used to service http client requests. (optional). When not present, an Executor will be allocated and scoped to this RemoteRepositoryManager instance. TODO Should this be deprecated since it does not force the caller to choose a value for useLBS?

        This version does not force the caller to decide whether or not the LBS pattern will be used. In general, it should be used if the end point is bigdata. This class is generally, but not always, used with a bigdata end point. The main exception is SPARQL Basic Federated Query. For that use case we can not assume that the end point is bigdata and thus we can not use the LBS prefix.

      • RemoteRepositoryManager

        public RemoteRepositoryManager(String serviceURL,
                               boolean useLBS,
                               org.eclipse.jetty.client.HttpClient httpClient,
                               Executor executor)
        Create a remote client for the specified serviceURL (core impl).
        Parameters:
        serviceURL - The path to the root of the web application (without the trailing "/"). /sparql will be appended to this path to obtain the SPARQL end point for the default data set.
        useLBS - When true, the REST API methods will use the load balancer aware requestURLs. The load balancer has essentially zero cost when not using HA, so it is recommended to always specify true. When false, the REST API methods will NOT use the load balancer aware requestURLs.
        httpClient - If the client implements AutoCloseable then it will be closed by close() (optional). When not present, an HttpClient will be allocated and scoped to this RemoteRepositoryManager instance.
        executor - An executor used to service http client requests. (optional). When not present, an Executor will be allocated and scoped to this RemoteRepositoryManager instance.

      • getTransactionManager

        Since:
        1.5.2
        See Also:
        Support read/write transactions in the REST API

      • getExecutor

        public Executor getExecutor()
        The executor for processing http and other client operations.

      • getBaseServiceURL

        public String getBaseServiceURL()
        The path to the root of the web application (without the trailing "/").

        Note: This SHOULD NOT be the SPARQL end point URL. The NanoSparqlServer has a wider interface. This should be the base URL of that interface. The SPARQL end point URL for the default data set is formed by appending /sparql.

      • getUseLBS

        public boolean getUseLBS()
        Return true iff the REST API methods will use the load balancer aware requestURLs. The load balancer has essentially zero cost when not using HA, so it is recommended to always specify true. When false, the REST API methods will NOT use the load balancer aware requestURLs.

      • getMaxRequestURLLength

        public int getMaxRequestURLLength()
        Return the maximum requestURL length before the request is converted into a POST using a application/x-www-form-urlencoded request entity.
        See Also:
        RemoteRepository class should use application/x-www-form-urlencoded for large POST requests

      • setMaxRequestURLLength

        public void setMaxRequestURLLength(int newVal)

      • getQueryMethod

        public String getQueryMethod()
        Return the HTTP verb that will be used for a QUERY (versus an UPDATE or other mutation operations) (default ). POST can often handle larger queries than GET due to limits at the HTTP client layer and will defeat http caching and thus provide a current view of the committed state of the SPARQL end point when the end point is a read/write database. However, GET supports HTTP caching and can scale much better when the SPARQL end point is a read-only resource or a read-mostly resource where stale reads are acceptable.
        See Also:
        setQueryMethod(String)

      • setQueryMethod

        public void setQueryMethod(String method)
        Set the default HTTP verb for QUERY and other idempotant operations.
        Parameters:
        method - The method which may be "POST" or "GET".
        See Also:
        getQueryMethod()

      • getRepositoryForURL

        public RemoteRepository getRepositoryForURL(String sparqlEndpointURL)
        Obtain a flyweight RemoteRepository for the data set having the specified SPARQL end point. The load balancer will be used or not as per the parameters to the RemoteRepositoryManager constructor.
        Parameters:
        sparqlEndpointURL - The URL of the SPARQL end point.
        Returns:
        An interface which may be used to talk to that data set.

      • getRepositoryForURL

        public RemoteRepository getRepositoryForURL(String sparqlEndpointURL,
                                            IRemoteTx tx)
        Obtain a flyweight RemoteRepository for the data set having the specified SPARQL end point. The load balancer will be used or not as per the parameters to the RemoteRepositoryManager constructor.
        Parameters:
        sparqlEndpointURL - The URL of the SPARQL end point.
        timestamp - The timestamp that will be added to all requests for the sparqlEndPoint (optional).
        Returns:
        An interface which may be used to talk to that data set.

      • getRepositoryDescriptions

        public org.openrdf.query.GraphQueryResult getRepositoryDescriptions()
                                                             throws Exception
        Obtain a VoID description of the configured KBs. Each KB has its own namespace and corresponds to a VoID "data set".

        Note: This method uses an HTTP GET and hence can be cached by the server.

        Returns:
        A VoID description of the configured KBs.
        Throws:
        Exception

        Note: This method uses an HTTP GET and hence can be cached by the server.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getRepositoryProperties

        public Properties getRepositoryProperties(String namespace)
                                   throws Exception
        Return the effective configuration properties for the named data set.

        Note: While it is possible to change some configuration options are a data set has been created, many aspects of a "data set" configuration are "baked in" when the data set is created and can not be changed. For this reason, no general purpose mechanism is being offered to change the properties for a configured data set instance.

        Parameters:
        namespace - The name of the data set.
        Returns:
        The effective configuration properties for that named data set.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • tupleResults

        public org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult tupleResults(ConnectOptions opts,
                                                       UUID queryId,
                                                       IPreparedQueryListener listener)
                                                throws Exception
        Extracts the solutions from a SPARQL query.
        Parameters:

        listener - The listener to notify when the query result has been closed (optional).
        Returns:
        The results.
        Throws:
        Exception - If anything goes wrong.

      • booleanResults

        public boolean booleanResults(ConnectOptions opts,
                              UUID queryId,
                              IPreparedQueryListener listener)
                       throws Exception
        Parse a SPARQL result set for an ASK query.
        Parameters:
        response - The connection from which to read the results.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on what was encoded in the SPARQL result set.
        Throws:
        Exception - If anything goes wrong, including if the result set does not encode a single boolean value.
